bugs.title: CVE-2012-1180 nginx: malformed HTTP response headers leads to information leak

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2012-1180 nginx: malformed HTTP response headers leads to information leak

long_desc.thetext:
A flaw was reported [1] in nginx versions prior to 1.0.14 and 1.1.17 where contents of previously freed memory could be sent to a client if an upstream server returned a specially crafted HTTP response.  This could potentially leak sensitive information to the HTTP client.

This has been corrected upstream [2],[3] and a patch [4] is available for earlier versions of nginx.

[1] http://seclists.org/bugtraq/2012/Mar/65
[2] http://trac.nginx.org/nginx/changeset/4530/nginx
[3] http://trac.nginx.org/nginx/changeset/4531/nginx
[4] http://nginx.org/download/patch.2012.memory.txt

Created nginx tracking bugs for this issue

Affects: fedora-all [bug 803858]
Affects: epel-all [bug 803859]
nginx-1.0.14-1.fc16 has been pushed to the Fedora 16 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
nginx-1.0.14-1.fc15 has been pushed to the Fedora 15 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
nginx-0.8.55-2.el5 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 5 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
nginx-1.0.14-1.el6 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
nginx-1.0.14-1.fc17 has been pushed to the Fedora 17 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

product (the top-level CVE bugs).  Please mention the CVE IDs being fixed

[bug automatically created by: add-tracking-bugs]

nginx-1.0.14-1.el6 has been submitted as an update for Fedora EPEL 6.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/nginx-1.0.14-1.el6

Jeremy,

Can you update version of nginx on EL5? EL5 has one old and unsupported version, probably insecure too.

Best regards

(In reply to comment #2)
> Can you update version of nginx on EL5? EL5 has one old and unsupported
> version, probably insecure too.

I chose not to update nginx for el5 because:
1) This CVE does not appear to affect the nginx 0.8.55
2) Packages for el5 aim for stability, not latest features
3) Nginx 0.8.x is still supported upstream [1]

I don't have a strong opinion on this, so I'd be fine if the other nginx co-maintainers want to update nginx for el5. However, I'm inclined to err on the side of stability rather than features.


[1] http://wiki.nginx.org/Install
"There are currently three versions of Nginx available: stable (1.0.x), development (1.1.x), and legacy (0.8.x)."
Yes, I i'll get to el5 tomorrow, there is a patch provided by nginx for legacy versions.

Package nginx-1.0.14-1.el6:
* should fix your issue,
* was pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 testing repository,
* should be available at your local mirror within two days.
Update it with:
# su -c 'yum update --enablerepo=epel-testing nginx-1.0.14-1.el6'
as soon as you are able to.
Please go to the following url:
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2012-0795/nginx-1.0.14-1.el6
then log in and leave karma (feedback).

nginx-0.8.55-2.el5 has been submitted as an update for Fedora EPEL 5.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2012-0809/nginx-0.8.55-2.el5
nginx-0.8.55-2.el5 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 5 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
nginx-1.0.14-1.el6 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
